definition: to be born with/to be gifted with
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: But the best protection is to have been born with a big brain.
sentences.chinese: 當然啦，最佳的防治方法是生就一個大腦袋瓜。

sentences.english: War is born with not so-called justice and Belial .
sentences.chinese: 戰爭本生就沒有所謂的正義和邪惡。

sentences.english: Everyone is born a genius but only a few ever realize it.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都生就一種天賦，但僅僅少數人曾發覺這一點。

sentences.english: A man of unyielding character, he would rather break than bend.
sentences.chinese: 這位烈士生就一身傲骨，從未在敵人面前屈服過。

sentences.english: She wears a charming oval-shaped face by nature.
sentences.chinese: 她生就一張迷人的鴨蛋形圓臉。

sentences.english: Freshwater eels are born prepared for the rough waters they face in life.
sentences.chinese: 淡水鰻往往一齣生就將面對一段最惡劣的水域生涯。

definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
second-eldest child in a family/(euphemism) penis
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
to cut open the abdomen/to disembowel/to speak from the heart
